title: Quality of care for peripheral artery disease is low, study suggests

title_detail.value: Quality of care for peripheral artery disease is low, study suggests

summary: Less than half of individuals with peripheral artery disease, which is a narrowing of arteries to the limbs, stomach and head, are treated with appropriate medications and lifestyle counseling. These findings highlight the need to improve the quality of care for this high-risk group of individuals.
